alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 2:10PM MST until January 05 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...South Central Mountains, Espanola Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, and Upper Rio Grande Valley. * WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday to 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-25 near Santa Fe. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley
